A description of the struggles of applying stoic philosophy in modern social interactions…

I have been developing my stoic practices for maybe roughly three years now after having seen of its profound improvements with Tim Ferriss as he used it as his operating system, a way of approaching life. And more and more I dived in this philosophy through Ryan Holiday, Marcus Aurelius and bits from Seneca and Epictetus. Stoicism is a foundational frame of thinking that I carry to almost any situation.

One of life’s modern struggles through viewing life from a stoic view is the tremendous number of activities that you need to handle with those who doesn’t approach life the same way. You can really see it in people’s faces that they either are confused or disoriented from the words I utter especially when it is well grounded in strict philosophy.
